TI TEMPERATURE-DEPENDENCE OF THE GAIN IN ERBIUM-DOPED FIBERS
SO JOURNAL OF LIGHTWAVE TECHNOLOGY
LA English
DT Article
ID AMPLIFIER; EMISSION
AB The temperature dependence of the gain in erbium-doped fibers between -20 and +85-degrees-C are discussed.  The characteristics of three types of erbium-doped fibers with different erbium concentrations and glass compositions are investigated.  The gain decreased with increasing temperature at the rate of -0.07 dB/degrees-C when pumped at 1.48-mu-m.  The change in the gain was small when pumped at 0.98-mu-m.  By measuring the change in the absorption and fluorescence spectra with temperature, we deduce that the change in the gain is due mainly to the change in the saturated population inversion.
RP KAGI, N (reprint author), FURUKAWA ELECT CORP LTD,YOKOHAMA RES & DEV LABS,2-4-3 OKANO,NISHI KU,YOKOHAMA 220,JAPAN.

TI PERPENDICULAR MAGNETIC-ANISOTROPY OF PDCO ALLOY IN MULTILAYERED
   STRUCTURE
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT SYMP OF THE 1990 SPRING CONF OF THE EUROPEAN MATERIALS RESEARCH SOC :
   MAGNETIC THIN FILMS, MULTILAYERS AND SUPERLATTICES
CY MAY 29-JUN 01, 1990
CL STRASBOURG, FRANCE
SP EUROPEAN MAT RES SOC, CNRS, IBM, ALMADEN RES, IBM GERMANY, PHILIPS EINDHOVEN, DUPONT CO, SIEMENS GERMANY
AB The magnetic anisotropy of multilayered films (MLFs) consisting of PdCo alloy and noble metal (Au, Cu, Pt, Pd) layers is investigated.  It is found that MLFs of (Au, Pt, Pd)/PdCo have a positive perpendicular anisotropy while Cu/PdCo has a negative one.  For MLFs with the PdCo layer thinner than about 30 angstrom, it is also found that the anisotropy is proportional to the strain in the PdCo layer, suggesting the anisotropy is from magnetostrictive origin.
RP NAKAMURA, K (reprint author), NAGOYA UNIV,DEPT ELECT ENGN,NAGOYA 46401,JAPAN.

TI PERPENDICULAR MAGNETIC-ANISOTROPY AND COERCIVITY OF PD/CO AND PT/CO
   MULTILAYERS WITH BUFFER LAYERS
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT SYMP OF THE 1990 SPRING CONF OF THE EUROPEAN MATERIALS RESEARCH SOC :
   MAGNETIC THIN FILMS, MULTILAYERS AND SUPERLATTICES
CY MAY 29-JUN 01, 1990
CL STRASBOURG, FRANCE
SP EUROPEAN MAT RES SOC, CNRS, IBM, ALMADEN RES, IBM GERMANY, PHILIPS EINDHOVEN, DUPONT CO, SIEMENS GERMANY
AB Pd/Co and Pt/Co multilayers were prepared by the rf sputtering method with buffer layers of Pt, Pd, Cu or SiAlON between the multilayers and glass substrates.  The effect of the buffer layers on the perpendicular anisotropy and coercivity as well as on the structure of the films were investigated.  Considerable correlation was found between the anisotropy and the structure of the multilayers.
RP TSUNASHIMA, S (reprint author), NAGOYA UNIV,DEPT ELECT ENGN,NAGOYA 46401,JAPAN.

TI PROPEPTIDE OF A PRECURSOR TO A PLANT VACUOLAR PROTEIN REQUIRED FOR
   VACUOLAR TARGETING
SO PROCEEDINGS OF THE NATIONAL ACADEMY OF SCIENCES OF THE UNITED STATES OF
   AMERICA
LA English
DT Article
DE PLANT VACUOLES; TARGETING SIGNAL; SECRETORY PATHWAY; STORAGE PROTEIN
ID POTATO TUBEROUS ROOTS; TRANSGENIC TOBACCO; ENDOPLASMIC-RETICULUM;
   STORAGE PROTEIN; SEQUENCE; GLYCOSYLATION; TRANSPORT; SEEDS; YEAST;
   PHYTOHEMAGGLUTININ
AB Sporamin is a protein without glycans that accumulates in large quantities in the vacuoles of the tuberous root of the sweet potato.  It is synthesized as a prepro precursor with an N-terminal extension composed of a 21-amino-acid signal peptide and a 16-amino-acid propeptide.  A total of 48 base pairs, corresponding to the nucleotide sequence that encodes the propeptide, was deleted from a cDNA clone for sporamin.  This DELTA-pro mutant sequence, as well as the sequence of the wild-type sporamin cDNA, was  placed downstream from the promoter of the 35S transcript from cauliflower mosaic virus and introduced into the genome of suspension-cultured tobacco cells by Agro-bacterium-mediated transformation.  In contrast to the vacuolar localization of sporamin in cells that expressed the wild-type precursor, sporamin was secreted into the culture medium from cells in which the DELTA-pro precursor was expressed.  The secreted form of sporamin was shorter by two amino acids at its N terminus than authentic sporamin; it migrated anomalously during electrophoresis on SDS/polyacrylamide gel as a result of the presence of intramolecular disulfide bridges, as does authentic sporamin.  The kinetics of secretion of sporamin from the cell were similar to those of proteins normally secreted by the host tobacco cells.  These results indicate that the propeptide of the precursor to sporamin is required for correct targeting of sporamin to the vacuole and that proteins can be secreted from plant cells by a bulk-flow default pathway in the absence of a functional sorting signal.
C1 NAGOYA UNIV,SCH AGR,BIOCHEM LAB,CHIKUSA KU,NAGOYA 46401,JAPAN.
RI Matsuoka, Ken/E-3215-2010

AU YONEZAWA, S

AF YONEZAWA, S
   NAKAMURA, K
TI SPECIES-SPECIFIC DISTRIBUTION OF CATHEPSIN-E IN MAMMALIAN BLOOD-CELLS
SO BIOCHIMICA ET BIOPHYSICA ACTA
LA English
DT Article
DE CATHEPSIN-E; LEUKOCYTE; ERYTHROCYTE
ID DEPENDENT PROTEIN-KINASE; SLOW-MOVING PROTEINASE; RAT GASTRIC-MUCOSA;
   ACID PROTEINASE; IMMUNOHISTOCHEMICAL LOCALIZATION;
   SUBCELLULAR-LOCALIZATION; ASPARTIC PROTEINASES; PHOSPHORYLATION;
   MEMBRANE; OXIDASE
AB The distribution of cathepsins D and E in leukocytes and erythrocyte ghosts of several mammalian species, and in HL-60 and K-562 cells was examined by means of a combined application of electrophoretic and immunochemical methods.  Cathepsin D was found in leukocytes of all species examined, but the distribution of cathepsin E was found to be species-specific:  pigs, cows and goats had no cathepsin E activity in leukocytes or erythrocytes at all.  In humans, cathepsin E occurred in erythrocytes but not in leukocytes, which contrasted with the guinea pig pattern of its presence in leukocytes and its absence in erythrocytes. No cathepsin E-related enzymes were found in HL-60 or K-562 cells, but these human leukemic cells contained cathepsin D-related enzyme forms that are electrophoretically distinct from normal leukocyte cathepsin D. The present results are inconsistent with the view that cathepsin E may be involved as an essential factor in the biological functions of leukocytes or erythrocytes.
RP YONEZAWA, S (reprint author), HOKKAIDO UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT ZOOL,SAPPORO,HOKKAIDO 060,JAPAN.
CR AZUMA T, 1989, J BIOL CHEM, V264, P16748
   Barrett A. J., 1977, PROTEINASES MAMMALIA, P209

   DODGE JT, 1963, ARCH BIOCHEM BIOPHYS, V100, P119, DOI 10.1016/0003-9861(63)90042-0

TI SEARCH FOR DAY-NIGHT AND SEMIANNUAL VARIATIONS IN THE SOLAR NEUTRINO
   FLUX OBSERVED IN THE KAMIOKANDE-II DETECTOR
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID OSCILLATIONS; MATTER; EARTH
AB Searches for possible day-night and semiannual variations of the B-8 solar neutrino flux are reported based on 1040 days of Kamiokande-II data.  Within statistical error, no such short-time variations were observed.  The limit on the day-night difference sets a constraint on neutrino-oscillation parameters.  A region defined by sin(2)2-theta-less-than-or-similar-to 0.02 and 2x10(-6) less-than-or-similar-to-DELTA-m2 less-than-or-similar-to 10(-5) eV2 is excluded at 90% C. L. without any assumption on the absolute value of the expected solar neutrino flux.
C1 NATL LAB HIGH ENERGY PHYS,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.
   NIIGATA UNIV,NIIGATA 95021,JAPAN.

SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &

HO DOSHISHA UNIV
DE STEP FREQUENCY METHOD; DIFFERENTIAL PHASE; DIFFERENTIAL FREQUENCY
   RESPONSE; TARGET LOCATION
ID FREQUENCY
AB The concept of differential phase is proposed for accurate target location by a step frequency CW sonar.  By use of the differential phase, the locations can be determined with distance accuracy much shorter than the wavelength of the sound wave.  The basic idea and experimental result are described.

TI SH-TYPE LEAKY SURFACE-WAVES ON ROTATED Y-CUT LITAO3 SUBSTRATES WITH A
   FERROELECTRIC INVERSION LAYER
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 11TH SYMP ON ULTRASONIC ELECTRONICS IN JAPAN ( USE 90 )
CY NOV 20-22, 1990
CL KYOTO, JAPAN
SP JAPAN SOC APPL PHYS
HO DOSHISHA UNIV
DE LITAO3; FERROELECTRIC INVERSION LAYER; SH-SAW; LEAKY SURFACE WAVE
AB The SH-type leaky surface wave on a 35-degrees rotated Y-cut LiTaO3 substrate with a ferroelectric inversion layer is theoretically analyzed and the propagation characteristics are described.  The calculated results show that the attenuation of the leaky SAW varies periodically with the product of the inversion layer thickness and the wave number, and the leaky wave reduces to a non-leaky surface wave at certain values of the product.  The phase velocity of the leaky surface wave decreases and the concentration of the displacement to the surface is improved by a quasi electric-field short-circuiting effect of the domain boundary.  It is also shown that the second mode exists in the substrate with a metallized surface.
C1 UNIV ELECTROCOMMUN,CHOFU,TOKYO 182,JAPAN.

TI MONJU CONSTRUCTION COMPLETED STEPPING FORWARD TO PRE-OPERATIONAL TESTS
SO JOURNAL OF THE ATOMIC ENERGY SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA Japanese
DT Article
DE MONJU REACTORS; NUCLEAR POWER PLANTS; DESIGN; FABRICATION; CONSTRUCTION
   WORK; NUCLEAR FUELS; REACTOR COMPONENTS; REACTOR STRUCTURES; HEAT
   TRANSPORT SYSTEM; FUEL HANDLING SYSTEM; INSTRUMENTATION
AB A Japanese prototype fast breeder reactor "MONJU" is a 280 MWe loop-type, sodium-cooled fast breeder reactor (FBR) with U-Pu mixed oxide fuel.
   The MONJU development program has been carried out as a national project by Power Reactor and Nuclear Fuel Development Corporation (PNC), in collaboration with the government, universities and the private sectors including utilities and manufacturers.  The program aims to develop an intermediate-scale precursor to a commercial reactor and to get experience with a power generating FBR.
   The construction work began in October 1985, and completed on schedule in April 1991 with no significant problem.  The pre-operational tests are presently underway.
   The present report describes the MONJU plant including the main features of its subsystems and components.  Some aspects of design, fabrication and construction work are also discussed.
RP MURAYAMA, M (reprint author), POWER REACTOR & NUCL FUEL DEV CORP,TOKYO,JAPAN.

TI CARRIER DYNAMICS SIMULATION OF ACOUSTOELECTRIC CURRENT NOISE IN
   SEMICONDUCTORS
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE COMPUTER SIMULATION; ACOUSTOELECTRIC INSTABILITY; PHONON AMPLIFICATION;
   NOISE; SEMICONDUCTORS
AB A computer simulation using particles has been performed to investigate the mechanism of tremendous low-frequency current noise associated with the acoustoelectric instability in piezoelectric semiconductors.  Electrons are trapped in the troughs of the piezopotential due to the acoustic wave amplified from the thermal background and are forced to move with the sound velocity.  However, the trapped electrons can transfer to the neighboring troughs not by external random force, but by intrinsic nonlinear dynamics.  This is the origin of the tremendous acoustoelectric current noise.
RP NAKAMURA, K (reprint author), NIHON UNIV,COLL HUMANITIES & SCI,DEPT PHYS,SETAGAYA KU,TOKYO 156,JAPAN.

TI SYNTHESIS AND THERMAL-PROPERTIES OF A CROSS-LINKABLE
   DIACETYLENE-POLYIMIDE
SO KOBUNSHI RONBUNSHU
LA Japanese
DT Article
DE DIACETYLENE; CROSS-LINKABLE POLYIMIDE; HIGH MODULUS
AB A novel crosslinkable diacetylene-polyimide was prepared from 4,4'-(1,3-butadiyne-1,4-diyl)-bis(phthalic anhydride) and p-phenylenediamine in order to develop a high temperature material with multidimensional high modulus.  The polyimide crosslinked thermally about 250-degrees-C.  The extent of crosslinking was 85%.  The storage modulus of the resulting crosslinked polyimide was about twice larger than that of non-crosslinked polyimides.  The plateau storage modulus of the crosslinked polyimide increased with increasing temperature as a result of crosslinkage of the diacetylene groups till higher temperatures than that of polyimides without diacetylene groups.
C1 ASAHI CHEM IND CO LTD,FIBERS DEV LAB,MIYAZAKI 882,JAPAN.

AF MORI, K
   MISHIMA, N

   IMURA, H
   OHASHI, K
TI ADSORPTION BEHAVIOR OF COPPER(II) WITH
   POLY[N-(8-HYDROXY-5-QUINOLYLMETHYL)-4-SULFAMOYLSTYRENE]
SO NIPPON KAGAKU KAISHI
LA Japanese
DT Article
AB Absorption behavior of copper(II) with poly[N-(8-hydroxy-5-quinolylmethyl)-4-sulfamoyl styrene] resin (PQS resin), which was prepared by the reaction of poly(chlorosulfonylstyrene) resin (styrene-2% divinylbenzene copolymer, 100 approximately 300 mesh) with 5-aminomethyl-8-quinolinol, was investigated by batch method.  The functional 8-quinolinol moiety in PQS resin was found to be 0.97 mmol/g-resin by the elemental analysis.  The water regain of PQS resin was to be 1.36 g/g-resin, which was almost the same as that of iminodiacetic acid chelate resin, suggesting that PQS resin was characterized by a less hyrophobicity.  The PQS resin is very stable even in 2 mol.dm-3 hydrochloric acid solution, but gradually decomposes to release 8-quinolinol group in 1 mol.dm-3 sodium hydroxide solution.  The maximum loading capacity for copper(II) was determined to be 0.13 mol/g-resin at pH 5.5 in the presence of 1.0 mol.dm-3 sodium chloride.  From a 20 cm3 solution of 1.0 x 10(-4) mol.dm-3 copper(II), copper(II) was quantitatively adsorbed onto 50 mg of PQS resin at pH 3.5 in the presence of 1.0 mol.dm-3 sodium chloride.  The equal amount of nickel(II), zinc(II) and cobalt(II) to copper(II) does not affect the adsorption efficiency of copper(II) at pH 2.7.  However, in a case of [Ni(II)]/[Cu(II)] = 50, the adsorption efficiency of copper(II) decreased by ca. 10%.  On the other hand, the adsorption efficiency of copper(II) does not lower even in the presence of fifty-times excess of zinc(II) at pH 2.7 approximately 3.3.
C1 IND PROD RES INST,TSUKUBA 305,JAPAN.
RP MORI, K (reprint author), IBARAKI UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT CHEM,MITO,IBARAKI 310,JAPAN.
CR AKAIWA H, 1975, CHEM LETT, P1049, DOI 10.1246/cl.1975.1049
   KOLOBIEL.M, 1966, J HETEROCYCLIC CHEM, V3, P275
   PARRISH JR, 1956, CHEM IND-LONDON, P137
   SLOVAK Z, 1975, ANAL CHIM ACTA, V75, P127, DOI 10.1016/S0003-2670(01)81960-7
   STARY J, 1963, ANAL CHIM ACTA, V28, P132, DOI 10.1016/S0003-2670(00)87211-6
   SURESH KS, 1984, COORDIN CHEM REV, V59, P1
   WARSHAWSKY A, 1989, J APPL POLYM SCI, V24, P1125
NR 7
TC 1
Z9 1

TI THE CHEMICAL-STRUCTURE AND THERMAL-PROPERTIES OF ALKALI ULTRAPHOSPHATES
SO POLYHEDRON
LA English
DT Article
AB Amorphous sodium and lithium ultraphosphates with M2O/P2O5 (M = Na or Li) ratios of 1.0-0.3 have been prepared by mixing 85% phosphoric acid and sodium carbonate or lithium carbonate and then heating the mixture at 400-700-degrees-C, in air and in dry nitrogen.  The ultraphosphates contained combined water and the amount of the water increased with a decrease in the M2O/P2O5 ratio.  When the ultraphosphates were heated in air, branching points in the ultraphosphates were hydrolysed to produce polyphosphates with shorter chain lengths.
RP WATANABE, M (reprint author), CHUBU UNIV,DEPT IND CHEM,KASUGAI,AICHI 487,JAPAN.

TI ANIONIC-POLYMERIZATION OF VINYLSILANES .2. MECHANISM OF ISOMERIZATION IN
   THE POLYMERIZATION OF TRIMETHYLVINYLSILANE WITH
   BUTYLLITHIUM-N,N,N',N'-TETRAMETHYLETHYLENEDIAMINE
SO POLYMER JOURNAL
LA English
DT Article
DE ANIONIC POLYMERIZATION; ISOMERIZATION POLYMERIZATION;
   TRIMETHYLVINYLSILANE; N,N,N'N'-TETRAMETHYLETHYLENEDIAMINE; H-1 NMR;
   RELAXATION TIME; PROTON ABSTRACTION; PENULTIMATE UNIT; END UNIT
AB The isomerization reaction in the anionic polymerization of trimethylvinylsilane (TMVS) with butyllithium (n-BuLi) in the presence of N,N,N',N',-tetramethylethylenediamine (TMEDA) was investigated. An equimolar amount of TMEDA with n-BuLi was found to be necessary and enough for the quantitative isomerization. The isomerization reaction was revealed to take place only intramolecularly. From the spin-lattice relaxation time measurements of the polymer obtained in the isomerization polymerization of TMVS, it was found out that the abstraction of a silymethyl proton from an end unit and the abstraction from a penultimate unit are both possible.
RP OKU, J (reprint author), NAGOYA INST TECHNOL, DEPT APPL CHEM, GOKISO CHO, SHOWA KU, NAGOYA, AICHI 466, JAPAN.
CR ASAMI R, 1988, POLYM J, V20, P699, DOI 10.1295/polymj.20.699

TI FORMATION OF THE GLASSY STATE AND MESOPHASE IN THE WATER-SODIUM ALGINATE
   SYSTEM
SO POLYMER JOURNAL
LA English
DT Article
DE SODIUM ALGINATE; WATER; GLASS TRANSITION; MESO-PHASE; DIFFERENTIAL
   SCANNING CALORIMETRY; NON-FREEZING WATER; GLASSY WATER
ID X-RAY-DIFFRACTION; STRUCTURAL COMPONENTS; CRYSTALLINE-STRUCTURE;
   PHASE-TRANSITION; ACID; POLYMERS
AB The phase transition of water-sodium alginate with water content (W(c)) (grams of water/gram of dry sample) from 0 to 2.5 was studied using differential scanning calorimetry (DSC).  Upon heating, glass transition (T(g)), cold crystallization and melting were observed in the W(c) range from 0.49 to 2.5.  At a W(c) less than 0.49, only T(g) was observed.  During cooling, the crystallization of water in the system was observed from the W(c) = 0.77.  The above difference suggests the presence of glassy water which crystallizes during the heating process.  The contribution of non-freezing water and glassy water to T(g) and C(p) of the system was estimated.
C1 RES INST POLYMERS & TEXT,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.
   IND PROD RES INST,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI SYNTHESIS AND PROPERTIES OF FLUORINE-CONTAINING EPOXY(METH)ACRYLATE
   RESINS
SO KOBUNSHI RONBUNSHU
LA Japanese
DT Article
DE FLUORINATION; EPOXY RESIN; EPOXYACRYLATE RESIN; EPOXYMETHACRYLATE RESIN;
   REFRACTIVE INDEX; RETURN LOSS; ADHESIVE STRENGTH
AB Novel fluorine-containing epoxyacrylate resins and epoxymethacrylate resins have been synthesized from two epoxy resins, diglycidylether of bis(1,1,1,3,3,3-hexafluoro-2-hydroxyisopropyl)cyclohexane and diglycidylether of 4,4'-bis(1,1,1,3,3,3-hexafluoro-2-hydroxyisopropyl)diphenylether.  Four synthesized resins can be cured by UV-irradiation, they show extremely low refractive indices of 1.428 approximately 1.495 due to their high fluorine contents of 29 approximately 34 wt%.  Cured resins are highly transparent to wavelengths from 0.5 to 1.6-mu-m; they demonstrate high adhesive strengths to quartz glass, more than 85 kgf/cm2.  These resins have a particular utility for the formulation of optically transparent adhesives, since they improve matching of the refractive index with that of optical glass.  The adhesive composition provides very high return loss more than 40 dB at the joints of optical fibers.
RP MARUNO, T (reprint author), NIPPON TELEGRAPH & TEL PUBL CORP,MUSASHINO ELECT COMMUN LAB,APPL ELECTR LABS,3-9-11 MIDORI CHO,MUSASHINO,TOKYO 180,JAPAN.

TI NONCENTROSYMMETRIC LANGMUIR-BLODGETT-FILM OF PHENYLPYRAZINE DERIVATIVE
   APPLICABLE TO NONLINEAR WAVE-GUIDES
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE PHENYLPYRAZINE; NONCENTROSYMMETRIC LANGMUIR-BLODGETT FILM; NONLINEAR
   OPTICS; 2ND-HARMONIC GENERATION
ID GENERATION
AB Thick noncentrosymmetric LB films of more than 200 bilayers (thickness of more than 1-mu-m) were successfully fabricated with an alternating deposition of a phenylpyrazine derivative and arachidic acid monolayers. The alternating LB films were transparent from visible to near infrared region.  Spectroscopic and X-ray diffraction studies on the alternating LB films proved that molecules were predominantly oriented normal to the film plane in the LB film.  Further, the quadratic dependence of second-harmonic (SH) intensity on film thickness was confirmed in the LB films in the wide range of thickness from 1 to 200 bilayers.  From the SH generation measurement, the alternating LB films were found to have fairly large second-order nonlinear susceptibility, which was estimated to be 1 X 10(-7) esu.
C1 KYUSHU UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT APPL CHEM,FUKUOKA 812,JAPAN.

TI TRANSITION TO CHAOTIC STATE IN SPIN-WAVE TURBULENCE
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 25TH CONF OF THE YAMADA SCIENCE FOUNDATION : MAGNETIC PHASE TRANSITIONS
CY APR 13-16, 1990
CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN
ID STRANGE ATTRACTORS
AB Parametric excitation of spin-waves in an yttrium iron garnet is studied within the coincidence regime of the first-order Suhl instability.  Above the spin-wave instability threshold, a period-doubling cascade is observed.  At this onset of chaos, the singularity spectrum f(alpha) is obtained.

TI EFFECT OF INSITU COOLING ON SUPERCONDUCTIVITY OF ARTIFICIALLY LAYERED
   BSCCO FILMS WITH 2223 STRUCTURE
SO JOURNAL OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
LA English
DT Article
DE BI2SR2CA2CU3OX; THIN FILMS; SEQUENTIAL DEPOSITION
AB Thin BSCCO films with the 2223 structure were deposited onto MgO substrate kept at 665-degrees-C by applying a sequential sputtering method using metallic Bi and Sr-Ca-Cu-O targets.  The resultant films were then cooled under various oxygen partial pressures and cooling rates.  It was found that the oxygen partial pressure and substrate temperature during cooling affect significantly the development of superconductivity of the as-deposited films.  When the films were cooled stepwise under a critical oxygen partial pressure around 0.3 torr, the as-deposited films showed either superconductivity or nonsuperconductivity behavior.  HRTEM images of the films showed no essential difference in the modulated structure, suggesting that the excess oxygen in the Bi-O double layers is the same and not the cause of the different superconducting behavior in the as-deposited films.
RP SATO, JC (reprint author), NATL RES INST MET,1-2-1 SENGEN,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.
NR 0

AU ITOH, H

   HAYAKAWA, H
AF ITOH, H
   NAKAMURA, K
   HAYAKAWA, H
TI CHARGING EFFECTS ON TRILEVEL RESIST WITH AN E-BEAM LITHOGRAPHY SYSTEM
SO JOURNAL OF VACUUM SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 34TH INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON ELECTRON, ION, AND PHOTON BEAMS
CY MAY 29-JUN 01, 1990
CL SAN ANTONIO, TX
SP AMER VACUUM SOC, IEEE, ELECTRON DEVICES SOC
ID INDUCED CONDUCTION
AB The charging effect on a trilevel resist system was investigated with a variable-shaped electron beam (e-beam) lithography system.  A test pattern which consists of two-dimensionally arrayed marks was exposed on the trilevel resist and measured by the e-beam.  A method evaluating the correlation of repetitive measurement errors due to charging has been developed.  This evaluation method was characterized such that the repetitive measurement and charging process occurred simultaneously without a conductive coating on the resist.  The evaluation method of the charging process at 20 and 30 kV is demonstrated in this article.  The resist result is different from that of silicon dioxide, and these phenomena are discussed together with the associated discharging processes.
C1 HITACHI LTD,CTR DEVICE DEV,OHME 198,JAPAN.
RP ITOH, H (reprint author), HITACHI LTD,NAKA WORKS,882 ICHIGE,KATSUTA 312,JAPAN.
CR ARIS FC, 1976, J PHYS C SOLID STATE, V9, P797, DOI 10.1088/0022-3719/9/5/018
   ATWOOD DK, 1989, SPIE P, V1089, P358
   BECKLEY LM, 1976, J PHYS D APPL PHYS, V9, P1355, DOI 10.1088/0022-3727/9/9/012
   CUMMINGS KD, 1989, J VAC SCI TECHNOL B, V7, P1532
   ITOH H, 1989, J VAC SCI TECHNOL B, V7, P1532, DOI 10.1116/1.584527
   KAZUMITSU K, 1985, J VAC SCI TECHNOL B, V3, P94

TI AN ADVANCED ELECTRON-BEAM LITHOGRAPHY SYSTEM FOR SUB-HALF-MICRON
   ULTRA-LARGE-SCALE PRODUCTION - THE DISTORTION CORRECTOR TECHNOLOGY
SO JOURNAL OF VACUUM SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 34TH INTERNATIONAL SYMP ON ELECTRON, ION, AND PHOTON BEAMS
CY MAY 29-JUN 01, 1990
CL SAN ANTONIO, TX
SP AMER VACUUM SOC, IEEE, ELECTRON DEVICES SOC
AB The manufacture of the critical layers of production of ultra-large-scale integration (ULSI) devices requires resolution beyond the capability of today's photolithography equipment.  JEOL has developed a high precision electron beam lithography system, the JBX-8600DV, which satisfies the demands of these new device designs.  The 8600DV employs advanced calibration algorithms to ensure accurate feature placement and linewidth control.  This paper discusses a real time distortion and aberration correction system which compensates for stepper lens distortions, wafer warpage, and deflector anomalies.  The system incorporates novel dynamic focus, astigmatism, and distortion corrector technologies to reduce distortion and aberration.  The corrector system utilizes a two-dimensional spline fitting technique to produce the proper correction coefficients.  This technology reduces linewidth dimensional errors to 0.03-mu-m(3-sigma) within a 2 mm deflection field and main field placement errors to < 0.04-mu-m.
C1 JEOL USA,PEABODY,MA 01960.
RP NAKAMURA, K (reprint author), JEOL LTD,3-1-2 MUSASHINO,TOKYO 196,JAPAN.
CR de Boor C., 1978, PRACTICAL GUIDE SPLI
   ICHIDA K, 1985, SPLINES THEIR APPLIC
